Group hierarchy: AWS Pricing Calculator provides only an estimate of your AWS fees and doesn't include any taxes that might apply. Your actual fees depend on a variety of factors, including your actual usage of AWS services.
My biggest overall cost is data transfer out from S3/CloudFront which is how user uploaded pictures and text are presented in the feed. So, the best way to save costs
is to limit the data transfer out to the internet. In this case, I've assumed that the application has reduced the length of time that user uploads
are stored in S3 and accessible, which led to reduced S3 storage and transfer out costs. I've also taken some additional minor risk by reducing the EC2 instances to T2.medium
and slightly reduced the size of the MySQL database assuming that slightly less user data could also be maintained and exchanged without significantly changing the user
